how would you describe your main use cas: As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: Yes, and I am the only editor/administrator of my wiki(s)
putting it all together, what value does: I dont use tiddlywiki at work. I use it to record discussions on our online book club in wiki form. In essence it is a traditional wiki.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki through web browser with Download Saver (default saving mechanism)
how do you back up/sync changes between: No automatic sync across my devices

outside of plugins, palettes and other i: I added a footer with custom images and CSS at the end of the html file.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: It's extremely easy to start a wiki. Having the whole wiki in a single file is perfect. No need to run and maintain a server. These are the best things about tiddlywiki.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
I researched "wiki engines" a year or so ago and did not pick tiddlywiki in part because I felt disoriented by the navigation style  - things changing the layout of the site all the time. This made me discard tiddlywiki as an option, probably more people do it too

I'm affraid Tiddlywiki is not suported in older or future browsers since it uses lots of javascript.

It feels tiddlywiki is quite complete, tbh. I don't see how could I contribute work to the project. I can donate money, though.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
